sentences.english: The idea is to make punishment, and therefore deterrence, possible.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法是为了让惩罚，因此也让威慑变得可能。

sentences.english: In addition, setting up powerful prevention overawe is an important assurance of financial safety.
sentences.chinese: 另外，建设强大的防范威慑也是金融安全的重要保证。

sentences.english: At the same time, the rarity of execution means it is no deterrent.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，绞刑的极少执行意也味着它不具有威慑性。

sentences.english: The ultimate object of terrorists is to achieve the maximum overawe.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖活动者的直接目的是追求最大的威慑效应。

sentences.english: Its assumption is that punishments serve a function of determent.
sentences.chinese: 这种偏见假定惩罚起起到威慑的作用。

sentences.english: The Chinese government has from the beginning opposed nuclear blackmail and the nuclear deterrent policy.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府历来反对核讹诈和核威慑政策。

sentences.english: A "Force de Frappe" , I believe was the term.
sentences.chinese: 那就是“核威慑力”，没记错的话应该就是这个术语。

sentences.english: There is little evidence that the death penalty deters .
sentences.chinese: 没有证据表明死刑极具威慑力量。

sentences.english: Nuclear weapons are the ultimate deterrent.
sentences.chinese: 核武器是终极的威慑力量。

sentences.english: Lighting because of the thieves have deterrent effect, while a burglar deterrent function.
sentences.chinese: 又因灯光对小偷有威慑作用，同时起到防盗阻吓功能。

sentences.english: Deterrence, not antimissile interceptors, is still the best defense.
sentences.chinese: 威慑而非反导拦截仍是最佳的防御手段。

sentences.english: It’s this edge that gives nuclear weapons their power to deter.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个优势赋予了核武器威慑力量。

sentences.english: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.chinese: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic  deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 这是肩负战略威慑职责的军事领袖们保家卫国的需要。

sentences.english: Instead, to some extent, they should be accepted as a necessary deterrent.
sentences.chinese: 某种意义上，核武器反而应被接受为一必要威慑。

sentences.english: Both can become the strategic deterrent weapon, and may take the convention tactical weapons.
sentences.chinese: 既能成为战略威慑性武器，又可作为常规战术武器。

definition: to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to take countermeasures against/to hit back/to counter
